results.title: Prophecy: a case study in marketing research
results.creator_credit: Linda Jassim, Carol Dunn, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Disney Channel is shown consulting the marketing research company ASI to find out how best to place Disney in the cable TV market. Executives from the companies explain the four P’s of marketing - product, price, place, promotion - to be considered when planning a market strategy. Examples of different types of surveys and testing are shown, including phone surveys, focus groups and previews. There is a short explanation of how the data is tabulated, indexed, collated and evaluated, but it is stressed that, however valuable the research is, intuition and experience also play a major part.

results.title: Gold in the hills: a case study in market segmentation
results.creator_credit: Hal Trussell, Carol Dunn, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Marketing / Coast Community College District”.
The Irvine Co. is one of the largest property developers in the United States. The success of their planned communities has depended on a careful study of the needs of different segments of the housing market and building to meet those needs. The program explores the history of the company and how it has adapted to changing economic situations in order to design communities which encourage people to live there all their lives, even though their needs change as they age.

results.title: Marketing in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
An account of the competition (suitably cut-throat) in the shaving market over the past few years. taking part are the top marketing men of the razor-blade and electric shaver industries. Wet versus dry, stainless verus non-stainless, Davids versus Goliaths. They form an ideal framework for an introduction to modern marketing in action.

results.title: The New distribution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
One of a marketing series which specifically deals with the problem of “How do you get your product from the shop floor to the high street?”. The series explores the whole range of marketing activities involved in moving a product or service from the factory to the consumer.

results.title: Birth of a new product
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
Many new products sink without a trace as soon as they are launched on the market. A case history of success and failure shows how the risks can be minimised. Part of a marketing series which highlights, in this film, the market research, the development of new products, advertising, selling and distribution.

results.title: Does advertising pay?
results.creator_credit: Alan Strowger, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
In 1965 British industry spent nearly 600 million pounds on advertising and sales promotion. Was the money well spent? Part of a series of films designed to present the theory and practice of modern marketing. Case histories of branded products (failures as well as successes) are given to illustrate particular market problems.

results.title: Go out and sell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
A commercial traveller with his foot in the door - or a merchandiser with a dump bin. What is the salesperson’s role in modern marketing? One of a series of films on modern marketing practices. The films explore the whole spectrum of activity including the salesperson’s role in selling and distribution. Presented by Christopher Chataway.

results.title: How to marry a millionaire
results.creator_credit: Jean Negulesco, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marilyn”.
Lauren Bacall, Betty Grable and Marilyn Monroe are three glamorous models on the lookout for a rich man. Pooling their funds, they decide to rent a luxurious Manhattan penthouse in order to lure their catch. Things are not what they appear to be as two of them fall in love with “poor men.” In the attempt to stop each other from marrying the wrong man, the threesome give their best performances. Utimately, it is love and not money which influences their choices. This film is a must see for lovers of Marilyn Monroe’s quirky and individualistic comedy style.
